Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate a plant with plenty of water and light, showing it healthy and growing.
The student can illustrate a plant without water, showing it wilted or not growing well.
The student can illustrate a plant without light, showing it not growing well or turning yellow.
The student can illustrate the different results of plants with and without water, indicating the need for water to survive.
The student can illustrate the different results of plants with and without light, indicating the need for light to survive.
The student can identify and label the elements of their drawings to show the presence or absence of water and light.
